cocktails.description: A long, sparkling agave spirit drink built for easy sipping, pairing Tequila Blanco, Angostura Bitters, Tonic with bubbly mixers over ice. Garnished with lime.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Shake all ingredients, except tonic with ice. 
2. Strain into a chilled glass.
3. Fill up with tonic.
4. Garnish with lemon wheel.

cocktails.name: Dry Martini
cocktails.description: A timeless mix of gin and dry vermouth served icy cold.
cocktails.instructions:
Add gin, vermouth, and bitters into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an olive or a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Dubonnet Cocktail
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and spirit-forward classic cocktail that perfectly balances the herbal complexity of Gin with the rich, wine-based aromatics of Dubonnet Rouge. Historically known as a favorite of the British Royal Family, it offers a deep, velvet texture and a refined botanical finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your rocks glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Fill a mixing glass with fresh ice cubes.
3. Pour the Gin and Dubonnet over the ice.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon for about 20-30 seconds until the drink is well-chilled.
5. Strain the mixture into the prepared rocks glass over fresh ice.
6. Garnish with a lemon twist or slice to add a bright citrus aroma.

cocktails.name: Dubonnet-Cassis
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and refreshing long drink that balances the rich, wine-based herbal notes of Dubonnet with the sweet, dark berry intensity of Creme de Cassis. Topped with soda, it’s an elegant low-alcohol choice for a refined palate.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice cubes to chill.
2. Pour the Creme de Cassis and Dubonnet over the ice.
3. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the ingredients.
4. Top up with soda water.
5. Give it one final light stir to mix without losing carbonation.
6. Garnish with a lemon twist or fresh berries if desired and serve.

cocktails.name: Eastern Promise
cocktails.description: An elegant and aromatic vodka-based sour that marries the floral notes of rose with the lush sweetness of apricot. This cocktail offers a sophisticated balance of tart citrus and botanical depth, making for a crisp and refreshing drink with a delicate floral finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Add the vodka, apricot brandy, rose syrup, and fresh lemon juice into a cocktail shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with 150g of ice cubes.
4. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until the outside of the shaker feels very cold.
5. Discard the ice from your chilled glass.
6. Double-strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into the chilled coupe glass.
7. Garnish with a dried rose bud or a lemon twist if desired.

cocktails.name: Eastside
cocktails.description: A bright gin sour balancing Gin, Mint, Cucumber with fresh citrus and a touch of sweetness for a crisp, refreshing sip.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Muddle: Place the cucumber slices and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker. Muddle thoroughly to extract the juice.
2. Add Mint: Drop in the mint leaves and muddle gently. Over-muddling mint can release bitter, "grassy" flavors.
3. Combine: Add the gin and lime juice. Fill the shaker with ice.
4. Shake: Shake vigorously for about 10–15 seconds until the outside of the shaker is frosty.
5. Double Strain: Pour the mixture through a Hawthorne strainer and a fine-mesh tea strainer into a chilled coupe or martini glass. This prevents small mint fragments and cucumber pulp from entering the drink.
6. Garnish: Float a thin cucumber wheel on the surface or garnish with a fresh mint sprig.

cocktails.name: El Diablo
cocktails.description: A classic highball that perfectly balances the earthy notes of tequila with the tart sweetness of blackcurrant liqueur and the spicy kick of ginger beer. It is a refreshing, vibrant, and slightly mysterious drink with a beautiful deep hue.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add the tequila, creme de cassis, and fresh lime juice to the shaker.
3. Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
5. Top up with ginger beer and stir gently to combine.
6. Garnish with a lime wedge or wheel.

cocktails.name: El Presidente
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and sleek Cuban classic that balances the crispness of white rum with the herbal notes of dry vermouth and the bright citrus of orange curaçao. Often called the 'Aristocrat of Cocktails,' it offers a smooth, ruby-tinted elegance perfect for slow sipping.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your cocktail glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Add the white rum, dry vermouth, orange curaçao, and a dash of grenadine into a mixing glass.
3. Fill the mixing glass with ice cubes.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon for about 20-30 seconds until the drink is well-chilled.
5. Strain the mixture through a Julep strainer into the chilled cocktail glass.
6. Garnish with a twist of orange peel or an orange slice to release aromatic oils.

cocktails.name: Electric Lemonade
cocktails.description: Named for its electric blue color, the Electric Lemonade cocktail can be shaken or stirred.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add 45ml of vodka, 30ml of lemon juice and 20ml of simple syrup.
Top with 60ml of 7-Up.
Float 15ml of blue curaçao on top.
Garnish with a lemon wedge and maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Emerald Banana
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and vibrant cocktail that balances the smooth warmth of Irish Whiskey with the exotic, tropical notes of green banana liqueur. Amaro Montenegro adds a complex botanical depth, resulting in a spirit-forward drink that is both aromatic and slightly bitter. Perfect for those who enjoy a modern twist on classic whiskey serves.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass in the freezer or by filling it with ice and water.
2. Add the Irish Whiskey, Pisang Ambon, and Amaro Montenegro into a mixing glass.
3. Fill the mixing glass with 150g of ice.
4. Stir gently but consistently for about 20-30 seconds until the drink is well-chilled and properly diluted.
5. Discard the ice from your coupe glass if necessary.
6. Strain the mixture into the chilled coupe glass using a Julep or Hawthorne strainer.
7. Garnish with a fresh mint sprig by gently slapping it against your hand to release the oils before placing it on the rim.

cocktails.name: Emerson
cocktails.description: A bright gin sour balancing Old Tom Gin, Red Vermouth, Maraschino Liqueur with fresh citrus and a touch of sweetness for a crisp, refreshing sip.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Prepare Glass: Chill a cocktail coupe or martini glass by filling it with ice and water or placing it in the freezer.
2. Combine Ingredients: Add the gin, sweet vermouth, lime juice, and maraschino liqueur into a cocktail shaker.
3. Shake: Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 10–15 seconds until the exterior is frosted.
4. Strain: Double strain (using a fine mesh strainer to catch ice shards) into your chilled glass.
5. Garnish: Drop in a maraschino cherry and serve.

cocktails.name: End of the Road
cocktails.description: A bold, spirit-forward liqueur drink built around Laphroaig, Campari, Green Chartreuse—bitter-leaning, aromatic, and best served well chilled.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine: Add all three ingredients into a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Stir: Stir well for about 20–30 seconds until the mixture is thoroughly chilled and properly diluted.
3. Strain: Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or Nick and Nora glass.
4. Serve: Typically served without a garnish to maintain its focused flavor profile.

cocktails.name: Eskimo Slugger
cocktails.description: A potent and refreshing dessert cocktail that strikes a perfect balance between the creamy sweetness of Irish cream, the purity of vodka, and the intense peppermint chill of Rumple Minze.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill a rocks glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Fill a cocktail shaker with approximately 150g of ice.
3. Pour the Baileys, Absolut Vodka, and Rumple Minze into the shaker.
4. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled.
5. Strain the mixture into the prepared rocks glass over fresh ice.
6. Serve immediately and enjoy the cool, creamy finish.

cocktails.name: Espresso Martini
cocktails.description: A smooth vodka martini energized with espresso and coffee liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well to create a foam.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with three coffee beans.

cocktails.name: Fergroni
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward twist on the classic Negroni. This cocktail elegantly balances the botanical notes of gin with the dark, bittersweet complexity of Punt e Mes and the herbal depth of Strucchi Bitter, resulting in a rich and aromatic sipping experience.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 50ml of Gin, 30ml of Punt e Mes, and 20ml of Strucchi Bitter into the mixing glass.
3. Stir gently for about 20-30 seconds until the drink is well-chilled and properly diluted.
4. Strain the mixture into a rocks glass over a large ice cube or fresh ice.
5. Express the oils from a lemon peel over the drink and garnish.

cocktails.name: Fernandito
cocktails.description: Argentina's favorite mix of Fernet and cola over ice.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour Fernet over the ice.
Top with cola and stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Final Ward
cocktails.description: Perhaps the most famous variation of the classic "Last Word" cocktail created by Phil Ward, with rye whiskey instead of gin and lemon juice instead of lime juice.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine 20ml of rye whisky, 20ml of Green Chartreuse, 20ml of maraschino liqueur and 20ml of lemon juice in a cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Fireball
cocktails.description: This recipe is for 3 shots.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Pour 75ml of white rum, 75ml of Goldschläger (cinnamon schnapps) and 3 dashes of Tabasco.
3. Shake well and strain into shots.

cocktails.name: First Word
cocktails.description: A bright gin sour balancing Gin, Maraschino Liqueur, Dry Vermouth with fresh citrus and a touch of sweetness for a crisp, refreshing sip.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine: Add all liquid ingredients into a cocktail shaker.
Ice: Fill the shaker with plenty of ice.
2. Shake: Shake vigorously for about 10–15 seconds until the outside of the shaker is well-chilled.
3. Strain: Double-strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or Nick & Nora glass.
4. Garnish: Traditionally garnished with a cocktail cherry or an orange peel.

cocktails.name: Flaming Dr Pepper
cocktails.description: Although Dr Pepper is not one of ingredients of this cocktail, it is claimed that it tastes like Dr Pepper.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour a pint of beer.
Pour 30ml of amaretto into a shot glass.
Carefully pour 15ml of overproof rum on top of the amaretto.
Light the shot and allow it to burn for several seconds.
Drop the flaming shot into the beer and drink.

cocktails.name: Flaming Lamborghini
cocktails.description: A very strong and beautiful cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 30ml of coffee liqueur into a cocktail glass.
Carefully pour 30ml of sambuca over the coffee liqueur.
Prepare 30ml of Baileys and 30ml of blue curaçao in two separate shots.
Light the sambuca and start drinking through the straw.
Don't stop – drink the two shots into the glass just before you finish the sambuca.

cocktails.name: Flaming Volcano
cocktails.description: This drink is something you want to share with your friends. Just get a volcano bowl, mix everything and add a flame. The ingredients can be varied greatly, so run wild and use long straws in this case!
cocktails.instructions:
Put some crushed ice into a bowl.
Add 30ml of white rum, 30ml of brandy and 30ml of dark rum.
Add 120ml of orange juice, 30ml of lemon juice and 60ml of almond syrup.
Blend well and pour into a volcano bowl.

cocktails.name: Flatliner
cocktails.description: A strong and really invigorating shot.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 20ml of sambuca into a shooter.
Carefully pour 25ml of tequila on top of the sambuca.
Add a dash of Tabasco.

cocktails.name: Flip #27
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and velvety dessert cocktail that masterfully blends the richness of Port with the deep notes of Aged Rum. The addition of raspberry syrup and heavy cream creates a luxurious, smooth texture, while the whole egg provides the classic frothy 'flip' finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine Port, Aged Rum, raspberry syrup, heavy cream, and the egg in a cocktail shaker.
2. Perform a 'dry shake' (without ice) vigorously for about 15 seconds to emulsify the egg.
3. Add ice to the shaker and shake again firmly until well-chilled.
4. Double strain the mixture into a chilled goblet glass to ensure a smooth texture.
5. Garnish with fresh raspberries on top.

cocktails.name: Fluffy Duck
cocktails.description: A stronger version of the cocktail. If you want something smoother, check out the 'Fluffy Duck 2'.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour 30ml of white rum, 30ml of egg liqueur and top with 10ml of cream.
Stir and garnish with a strawberry.

cocktails.name: Fluffy Duck 2
cocktails.description: This sweet and soft drink is the smoother variation of the "Fluffy Duck".
cocktails.instructions:
Put some ice cubes into a highball glass.
Pour 30ml of egg liqueur and 30ml of crème de cacao white, and slowly top with 7-Up according to taste.
Gently stir.

cocktails.name: Fort Point
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward riff on the Manhattan. This cocktail combines the spicy bite of Rye Whisky with the bitter-sweet complexity of Punt e Mes and the herbal honey notes of Benedictine. It is a deep, aromatic, and perfectly balanced drink meant to be savored slowly.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your Nick and Nora glass in the freezer or by filling it with ice.
2. Combine the Rye Whisky, Punt e Mes, and Benedictine in a mixing glass.
3. Fill the mixing glass with ice cubes.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon for about 20-30 seconds until the drink is well-chilled and properly diluted.
5. Strain the mixture into the chilled glass using a Julep strainer.
6. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and serve.

cocktails.name: French 75
cocktails.description: Crisp gin and lemon topped with sparkling champagne.
cocktails.instructions:
Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled champagne flute.
Top with champagne.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: French Connection
cocktails.description: Equal-parts blend of cognac and amaretto served over ice.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour all ingredients into an ice-filled rocks glass.
Stir gently.

cocktails.name: French Dew Sour
cocktails.description: An elegant and sophisticated twist on the classic sour, the French Dew Sour combines the deep, oaky notes of Cognac with the herbal complexity of Benedictine. Infused with fresh rosemary and a hint of black pepper, this cocktail offers a creamy texture thanks to the egg white, balanced by a bright citrus finish and a touch of warm vanilla.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Lightly muddle the fresh rosemary and black pepper in the bottom of a cocktail shaker.
2. Add the Cognac, Benedictine, lemon juice, rich simple syrup, egg white, Angostura bitters, and vanilla extract to the shaker.
3. Perform a 'dry shake' (without ice) for about 15 seconds to emulsify the egg white and create a thick foam.
4. Add plenty of ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
5. Double strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a chilled rocks glass over a large ice cube.
6. Garnish with a fresh rosemary sprig and an extra crack of black pepper if desired.

cocktails.name: French Martini
cocktails.description: Vodka shaken with raspberry liqueur and pineapple juice.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

cocktails.name: French Pearl
cocktails.description: Created by Audrey Saunders, this modern classic is a sophisticated gin sour that bridges the gap between a Southside and a Pastis-heavy aperitif. The anise notes from the Pastis beautifully complement the fresh mint and botanical gin, resulting in a complex, refreshing, and herbal cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Gently muddle the fresh mint leaves with the rich simple syrup in a cocktail shaker to release the essential oils.
2. Add the gin, pastis, and fresh lime juice to the shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Double strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a chilled coupe glass to remove mint fragments.
5. Garnish with a lime wheel and a fresh mint sprig.

cocktails.name: Fresh Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktails.description: A vibrant and sophisticated twist on the classic Daiquiri. This cocktail combines the lush sweetness of muddled strawberries with crisp white rum and zesty lime, enhanced by a subtle pinch of black pepper and salt to elevate the fruity notes.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Place 7 fresh strawberries into a shaker and muddle thoroughly to release their juices.
2. Add the white rum, fresh lime juice, rich simple syrup, black pepper, and salt to the shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Double strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a chilled coupe glass to remove strawberry seeds and pulp.
5. Garnish with a fresh strawberry on the rim.

cocktails.name: Frost Bite
cocktails.description: A cooling yet potent shooter that blends the warming depth of Cognac with the icy kick of peppermint. Perfect as a bold digestif or a winter-themed party shot.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the peppermint schnapps and cognac in a mixing glass or shaker filled with ice.
2. Stir gently for about 15 seconds to chill the spirits without over-diluting.
3. Strain the liquid into a chilled shooter glass.
4. Serve immediately while ice-cold.

cocktails.name: Frozen Daiquiri
cocktails.description: A variation of the popular Daiquiri cocktail with ice cream.
cocktails.instructions:
Put some crushed ice into a blender.
Add 45ml of white rum, 20ml of lemon or lime juice, 5ml of sugar syrup and 1 scoop of ice cream.
Blend until it is smooth and pour into a chilled goblet.

cocktails.name: Fuzzy Navel
cocktails.description: This cocktail became popular in the 1980s. 'Fuzzy' refers to the peach and 'navel' to the orange. Peach schnapps and orange juice amounts can be varied. There is a variation called 'Hairy Navel' with vodka.
cocktails.instructions:
Put some ice cubes into a highball glass.
Pour 50ml of peach schnapps.
Top with orange juice, and garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Galliano Hotshot
cocktails.description: A layered shot with Galliano, coffee and cream.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 20ml of Galliano into a shooter glass.
Carefully add 20ml of espresso and 10ml of cream on top of the Galliano.

cocktails.name: Garibaldi
cocktails.description: Italian mix of bitter Campari and fresh orange juice.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour in Campari and orange juice.
Stir gently.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

cocktails.name: Gem
cocktails.description: A sophisticated tropical delight that balances the depth of aged rum and cognac with the bright acidity of lime and the lush sweetness of pineapple. This cocktail offers a complex, velvety texture with a refreshing finish, perfect for an upscale beach vibe.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Add the aged rum, cognac, lime juice, pineapple syrup, rich simple syrup, and bitters into a cocktail shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Discard the ice from your coupe glass.
5. Double-strain the mixture into the chilled glass to ensure a smooth texture.
6. Garnish with an orange twist or slice.

cocktails.name: Genever Fruit Cup
cocktails.description: A refreshing and bubbly long drink that showcases the malty notes of Oude Genever paired with citrusy curaçao and herbal red vermouth. Topped with ginger ale and cola, it's a botanical, fruit-forward sparkler perfect for social sipping.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a Collins glass with fresh ice cubes.
2. Pour the Oude Genever, orange curaçao, and red vermouth directly into the glass.
3. Add the Angostura bitters.
4. Top the mixture with ginger ale and cola.
5. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the ingredients without losing the carbonation.
6. Garnish generously with orange and lemon slices, strawberries, and a sprig of mint (and borage if available) to enhance the aroma.

cocktails.name: Gibson
cocktails.description: A strong gin martini garnished with a silverskin onion.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice and add 60ml of gin and 10ml of dry vermouth.
Stir and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a silverskin onion peel.

cocktails.name: Gimlet
cocktails.description: A classic gin-based cocktail with a long history.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Add 60ml of gin and 15ml of lime juice.
Optionally, add 15ml of sugar syrup.
Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Gin & Tonic
cocktails.description: A timeless and refreshing highball cocktail that perfectly balances the botanical notes of gin with the crisp bitterness of tonic water. This effervescent drink is elevated by a bright citrus aroma, making it a sophisticated yet simple choice for any occasion.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with large ice cubes to keep the drink chilled without diluting it too quickly.
2. Pour 60ml of gin over the ice.
3. Top with 120ml of premium tonic water, pouring slowly to maintain carbonation.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the ingredients without losing the bubbles.
5. Garnish with a fresh lime wedge or wheel, squeezing it slightly before dropping it into the glass.

cocktails.name: Gin and Sin
cocktails.description: This cocktail's name speaks for itself. Bright, strong and good for adventure. It may be prepared as a shot.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 30ml of gin, 30ml of lemon juice, 30ml of orange juice and a dash of grenadine.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Gin Basil Smash
cocktails.description: Herbal gin sour brightened with fresh basil.
cocktails.instructions:
Muddle basil and simple syrup in a shaker.
Add gin, lemon juice, and ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a rocks glass over ice.
Garnish with a basil leaf.

cocktails.name: Gin Fizz
cocktails.description: Classic gin sour lengthened with soda water.
cocktails.instructions:
Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a highball glass.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

cocktails.name: Gin Rickey
cocktails.description: This classic cocktail is considered the best of the 'Rickey' group of drinks, which are made from a base spirit, lime juice and soda.
cocktails.instructions:
Put some ice into a highball glass.
Add 50ml of gin and 30ml of lime juice. Top with soda.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Gin Sour
cocktails.description: The Gin Sour is a classic 'sour' cocktail. It can be served in a cocktail glass or a rocks glass.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine 60ml of gin, 30ml of lemon juice, 15ml of sugar syrup and an optional egg white into a cocktail shaker.
Add ice, shake again, and strain into a cocktail glass or a rocks glass with ice.
Garnish with either a lemon slice and maraschino cherry or with several drops of Angostura bitters.

cocktails.name: Gladiator
cocktails.description: This recipe is for 3 shots, but you can make it as a long drink by mixing all the ingredients together in a collins glass.
cocktails.instructions:
Prepare a shot with 25ml of amaretto and 25ml of peach schnapps.
Mix around 70ml of 7-Up and 70ml of orange juice in a pub glass.
Drop the shooter into the pub glass and drink quickly.

cocktails.name: Godfather
cocktails.description: A good mix of Scotch and amaretto, this rich-flavoured cocktail is an IBA official cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
Pour 35ml of Scotch and 35ml of amaretto over the ice.

cocktails.name: Godmother
cocktails.description: Also called "Tawny Russian", this IBA official cocktail is a softer variation of another classic cocktail – Godfather.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
Pour 35ml of vodka and 35ml of amaretto over the ice.

cocktails.name: Gold Rush
cocktails.description: A variation of the "Whiskey Sour" with honey instead of sugar syrup.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine 60ml of bourbon, 20ml of lemon juice and 20ml of honey syrup with ice in a cocktail shaker.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Golden Cadillac
cocktails.description: An after-dinner cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 20ml of Galliano, 20ml of crème de cacao white and 20ml of cream.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Golden Dream
cocktails.description: An IBA official cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 20ml of Galliano, 20ml of triple sec, 20ml of orange juice and 10ml of cream.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Grand Margarita
cocktails.description: Premium take on the classic Margarita with tequila and Grand Marnier.
cocktails.instructions:
Rim a margarita glass with salt.
Shake tequila, Grand Marnier, lime juice, and agave syrup with ice.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

cocktails.name: Grasshopper
cocktails.description: Creamy after-dinner mix of mint and chocolate liqueurs.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Greek Tragedy
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and vibrant wine-based sour that masterfully balances the herbal notes of Ouzo with the botanical depth of Red Vermouth. The addition of raspberry liqueur provides a lush fruity undertone, while fresh lime juice ensures a crisp, refreshing finish. Elegant and complex, it is a perfect modern twist on Mediterranean flavors.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Combine the Ouzo, Red Vermouth, Raspberry Liqueur, and fresh lime juice in a cocktail shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with 150g of ice.
4. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until the exterior of the shaker feels very cold.
5. Discard the ice from your chilled coupe glass.
6. Double strain the mixture into the glass to ensure a smooth texture.
7. Garnish with a cherry and a lime twist to serve.

cocktails.name: Green Mexican
cocktails.description: A big and quite strong cocktail that is definitely not for everybody!
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a collins glass with ice.
Add 90ml of tequila and 90ml of Midori, then fill the rest with approximately 45ml of lemon juice and 45ml of sugar syrup.

cocktails.name: Green Mexican (shot)
cocktails.description: The shot variation of the "Green Mexican" cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 20ml of Midori into a shooter glass.
Carefully add 10ml of lime juice and 20ml of tequila.

cocktails.name: Green Tea
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and aromatic vodka cocktail that blends the herbal notes of Bison Grass Vodka with the tropical sweetness of Pisang Ambon and a subtle cooling hint of white mint. Despite its name, it contains no tea, but offers a complex, spirit-forward profile complemented by crisp apple juice.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your cocktail glass in the freezer or by filling it with ice.
2. Add the Bison Grass Vodka, Pisang Ambon, Creme de Menthe White, and apple juice into a mixing glass or shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with 150g of ice.
4. Shake well for about 10-15 seconds until the drink is thoroughly chilled.
5. Strain the mixture into the chilled cocktail glass.
6. Garnish with a fresh banana slice or peel to enhance the tropical aroma.

cocktails.name: Green Vesper
cocktails.description: A popular variation of the "Vesper" cocktail invented by James Bond in "Casino Royale". The original recipe has Kina Lillet instead of absinthe.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice.
Add 60ml of gin, 20ml of vodka and 10ml of absinthe.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Greyhound
cocktails.description: The Greyhound is a softer variation of the "Salty Dog" without salt. As with the Salty Dog, gin is often substituted with vodka.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a collins glass with ice cubes.
Add 50ml of gin and 200ml of grapefruit juice.
Stir well and garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: H.S.L. Special
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and bright liqueur-based sour that masterfully balances the herbal complexity of Amaro Montenegro with the deep berry notes of Creme de Mure. The addition of fresh lime and a hint of absinthe creates a refreshing, multi-layered profile with a crisp finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your rocks glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Combine Amaro Montenegro, Creme de Mure, lime juice, rich simple syrup, and the dash of absinthe in a cocktail shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with plenty of ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Freshly fill your chilled rocks glass with clean ice.
5. Strain the mixture into the glass using a Hawthorne strainer.
6. Garnish with a fresh blackberry or a lime wheel if desired.

cocktails.name: Hairy Navel
cocktails.description: This is a stronger variation of the "Fuzzy Navel" cocktail with vodka.
cocktails.instructions:
Put some ice cubes into a highball glass.
Pour 50ml of peach schnapps and 30ml of vodka.
Top with orange juice, and garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Hanky Panky
cocktails.description: Classic gin and vermouth cocktail with a hint of Fernet.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

cocktails.name: Harvard
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and aromatic twist on the classic Manhattan, swapping whiskey for brandy. This spirit-forward drink offers a rich, velvety texture with a complex botanical finish from the Angelica root.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your cocktail glass in the freezer or fill it with ice water.
2. Combine brandy, red vermouth, gomme syrup, and the Angelica root infusion in a mixing glass.
3. Fill the mixing glass with plenty of ice.
4. Stir gently for about 20-30 seconds until the drink is well-chilled and properly diluted.
5. Strain the mixture into the chilled cocktail glass.
6. Express the oils of a lemon peel over the top if desired and serve.

cocktails.name: Harvest Negroni
cocktails.description: A robust, autumnal variation of the Negroni. The apple-based Calvados replaces gin, pairing beautifully with the bittersweet notes of Cynar and Punt e Mes for a deep, earthy flavor profile.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with a large ice cube or fresh ice.
2. In a mixing glass, combine Calvados, Punt e Mes, Cynar, Strucchi Bitter, and Creole Bitters.
3. Add ice to the mixing glass and stir for 20 seconds to achieve the perfect temperature.
4. Strain the liquid into the prepared rocks glass over fresh ice.
5. Garnish with a fresh apple slice or an apple fan.
6. Serve immediately while cold.

cocktails.name: Harvey Wallbanger
cocktails.description: This IBA official cocktail was invented in 1952 by famous three-time world champion mixologist Donato "Duke" Antone.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour 45ml of vodka and 90ml of orange juice over the ice.
Stir gently and top with 15ml of Galliano.
Garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Hazelnut Alexander
cocktails.description: A nutty twist on the classic Brandy Alexander. This cocktail blends the deep notes of Cognac with rich chocolate and toasted hazelnut, rounded out by silky cream for a luxurious, dessert-like finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Add the Cognac, Creme de Cacao, hazelnut liqueur, and cream into a cocktail shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with plenty of ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Discard the ice from your glass and fine-strain the mixture into the chilled coupe.
5. Add a dash of Angostura bitters on top if desired.
6. Garnish by grating fresh chocolate over the surface.

cocktails.name: Hazelnut Martini
cocktails.description: An interesting Martini variation with Frangelico (hazelnut liqueur) and cacao liqueur. If you like it mild, some recipes also suggest adding about a half shot of cream.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine 60ml of vodka, 15ml of Frangelico and 15ml of crème de cacao white in a shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Hellboy
cocktails.description: A very interesting cocktail if you like whisky-based (especially smoky whisky-based) drinks. It's not too popular throughout the world, but it is known in Zurich bars, notably Old Crow and Widder Bar. Chili-infused honey syrup is difficult to find in stores but easy to make yourself.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine 50ml of Islay whisky, 10ml of Frangelico and half a teaspoon of chili-infused honey.
Stir well and add some ice cubes.
Strain into a rocks glass and add a big ice cube.

cocktails.name: Hemingway Special
cocktails.description: A tart rum sour with grapefruit and maraschino liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Highball
cocktails.description: A classic popular cocktail that is best made with Canadian whisky.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour 60ml of whisky over the ice, and top with ginger ale.

cocktails.name: Hiroshima
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy spirit drink featuring Sambuca, Baileys, Absinthe—dessert-like, smooth, and indulgent.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 20ml of sambuca into a shooter glass.
Carefully pour 15ml of Baileys and 15ml of absinthe.
Add several grenadine drops using a straw.

cocktails.name: Honey Badger
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and herbal twist on the classic whiskey sour. This cocktail marries the bold warmth of Bourbon with the complex botanical notes of Yellow Chartreuse, sharpened by a kick of ginger and softened by floral honey. A sprig of rosemary adds an aromatic depth that makes every sip crisp and refreshing.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Lightly muddle the fresh rosemary sprig in the bottom of a cocktail shaker to release its essential oils.
2. Add the Bourbon, Yellow Chartreuse, ginger syrup, honey syrup, lemon juice, and lemon bitters into the shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Fine strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
5. Garnish with a fresh rosemary sprig and serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Horny Bull (long)
cocktails.description: Similar to the Screwdriver but with tequila instead of vodka.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add 50ml of tequila, and top with orange juice.

cocktails.name: Horny Bull (shot)
cocktails.description: This is a strong shooter version of the Horny Bull long drink. Some people prefer it with vodka.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour tequila and rum in equal proportions into a shot glass.
Optionally, add vodka.

cocktails.name: Horse's Neck
cocktails.description: Cognac highball sharpened with ginger ale and bitters.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add cognac and bitters.
Top with ginger ale.
Garnish with a long lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Hot Buttered Rum
cocktails.description: A traditional hot winter drink. Some recipes suggest using warm cider instead of water. The sugar in the recipe can be substituted with honey.
cocktails.instructions:
Put 1 teaspoon of butter into a toddy (Irish coffee) glass.
Add 1-2 teaspoons of dark sugar, 1 dash of ground cinnamon and 1/16 teaspoon of ground nutmeg.
Pour 50ml of rum and top with 100ml of hot (not boiling) water.
Stir well until the butter and sugar are dissolved.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a lemon slice.

cocktails.name: Hot Toddy
cocktails.description: A warming mix of whiskey, honey, lemon and hot water.
cocktails.instructions:
Put 1 teaspoon of honey on the bottom of an Irish coffee glass.
Pour 45ml of whiskey and squeeze in a quarter of a lemon.
Fill the glass with 100ml of hot water or tea.

cocktails.name: Hurricane
cocktails.description: A classic tropical cocktail popularized in 1940s New Orleans.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice.
Add white rum, dark rum, optional overproof rum, passion fruit puree, orange juice, lime juice, grenadine and simple syrup.
Shake well and strain into a hurricane glass filled with ice.
Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.

cocktails.name: IBA Tiki
cocktails.description: Fruity tiki blend of rums, juices, and exotic syrups.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients except garnishes into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a tiki glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with mint and pineapple.

cocktails.name: Illegal
cocktails.description: Smoky mezcal balanced with herbal Chartreuse and lime.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Improved Scotch Sling
cocktails.description: Scotch-based take on the Improved Whisky Cocktail with honey and maraschino.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Incredible Hulk
cocktails.description: A vibrant green mix of cognac and Hpnotiq named after the comic book hero.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour 50ml of Hpnotiq and 50ml of cognac over the ice.
Stir gently.

cocktails.name: Indian Paintbrush
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and vibrant gin-based cocktail that beautifully marries the botanical notes of gin with the earthy aroma of rosemary and the tart brightness of grapefruit. This drink offers a perfect balance of herbal sweetness and citrus punch, making it a refreshing choice for any occasion.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. Combine the gin, rosemary syrup, lime juice, and grapefruit juice in a cocktail shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with plenty of ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Discard the ice from your coupe glass.
5. Double-strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into the chilled glass.
6. Garnish with a fresh sprig of rosemary or a grapefruit twist if desired.

cocktails.name: Innocent Sex
cocktails.description: Layered shooter of sambuca, Cointreau and Irish cream.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 20ml of sambuca into a shooter glass.
Carefully add 15ml of Cointreau and 15ml of Baileys.
If desired, light it and drink through a straw.

cocktails.name: Irish Alexander
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy dessert cocktail that offers a sophisticated twist on the classic Brandy Alexander. By combining smooth Cognac with velvety Irish Cream and fresh cream, it creates a luxurious, silk-like texture with deep notes of cocoa and vanilla.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass in the freezer or by filling it with ice.
2. Add the Irish Cream, Cognac, and fresh cream into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
3. Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until the shaker is well-frosted.
4. Double strain the mixture into the chilled coupe glass to ensure a smooth texture.
5. Dust the top lightly with cocoa powder for garnish.

cocktails.name: Irish Apple Pie
cocktails.description: A comforting and aromatic highball that captures the essence of a freshly baked apple pie. The warmth of Irish Whisky blends perfectly with the sweetness of apple juice and the spicy kick of cinnamon, making it an ideal choice for cozy evenings.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with large ice cubes.
2. Pour the Irish Whisky and apple juice over the ice.
3. Add a pinch of ground cinnamon and stir gently to combine the flavors.
4. Garnish with a cinnamon stick and fresh apple slices to enhance the aroma.
5. Serve immediately while cold.

cocktails.name: Irish Car Bomb
cocktails.description: Drop a shot of whiskey and Irish cream into stout for a quick-drinking bomb.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 250ml of Guinness into a pub glass.
Pour 30ml of Baileys into a shot glass and gently add 20ml of whiskey.
Drop the shot into the stout and drink immediately.

cocktails.name: Irish Coffee
cocktails.description: Warm blend of Irish whiskey, hot coffee, and cream.
cocktails.instructions:
Add brown sugar to a heatproof glass.
Pour in hot coffee and stir until dissolved.
Add Irish whisky and stir.
Float lightly whipped cream on top.

cocktails.name: Irish Flag
cocktails.description: Layered shot showing the green, white and orange of the Irish flag.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 20ml of green crème de menthe into a shooter.
Carefully layer 15ml of Baileys and 15ml of Grand Marnier on top.

cocktails.name: Irish Frog
cocktails.description: Simple layered shot with melon liqueur and Irish cream.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 25ml of Midori into a shooter.
Carefully add 25ml of Baileys on top of the Midori.

cocktails.name: Irish Pie Tobby
cocktails.description: A delightful twist on the whiskey sour that evokes the flavors of a homemade apple pie. The warmth of Irish Whiskey pairs perfectly with sweet vanilla and crisp apple juice, balanced by a sharp citrus finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your Irish coffee glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. In a cocktail shaker, combine the Irish Whiskey, vanilla syrup, apple juice, and fresh lemon juice.
3. Fill the shaker with plenty of ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
5. Garnish with a fresh apple slice, a cinnamon stick for aroma, and an orange twist.

cocktails.name: Islander
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward cocktail for those who appreciate complex herbal notes. This drink blends the botanical richness of Red Vermouth with the smoky depth of Scotch, finished with a subtle hint of anise.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pre-chill a coupe glass in the freezer.
2. Add the Red Vermouth, Scotch Whiskey, and Anisette into a mixing glass filled with ice.
3. Stir gently but thoroughly for about 30 seconds to achieve the perfect dilution and temperature.
4. Fine strain the liquid into the chilled coupe glass.
5. Express the oils from a lemon peel over the drink and use it as a garnish.

cocktails.name: Jack and Coke
cocktails.description: Simple and popular mix of Jack Daniel's and cola.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a collins glass with ice.
2. Pour 50ml of Jack Daniel's and 150ml of cola over the ice.
3. Stir gently.

cocktails.name: Jack Rose
cocktails.description: Early 20th century classic of apple brandy, lemon and grenadine.
cocktails.instructions:
Add calvados, the juice of half a lemon, grenadine and optional egg into a shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or apple slice.

cocktails.name: Jägerbomb
cocktails.description: Also called "Flying Meister" or "Turbojäger" in German-speaking countries.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour half a can of Red Bull into a pub glass.
Make a shot of Jägermeister, and drop it into the glass with the Red Bull.

cocktails.name: Jagertee
cocktails.description: Hot black tea spiked with overproof rum and sweetened to taste.
cocktails.instructions:
Make a cup of black tea.
Add 40ml of overproof rum.
Add sugar according to your taste.

cocktails.name: Japanese Slipper
cocktails.description: This popular cocktail was created in 1984 by Jean-Paul Bourguignon at Mietta's Restaurant in Melbourne.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 30ml of Midori, 30ml of Cointreau and 30ml of lemon juice.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a small slice of honeydew melon.

cocktails.name: Jelly Bean
cocktails.description: Layered shooter with grenadine, sambuca and Southern Comfort.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 15ml of grenadine into a shooter.
Carefully add 15ml of sambuca and 15ml of Southern Comfort on top of the grenadine.

cocktails.name: Jellyfish
cocktails.description: A mild and nice-looking shot that slightly resembles a jellyfish.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 25ml of crème de cacao white into a shooter glass.
Gently add 10ml of amaretto on top.
Gently pour 15ml of Baileys on top of the amaretto.
Add a few drops of grenadine.

cocktails.name: Jellyfish 2
cocktails.description: A stronger variation of the Jellyfish cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 15ml of sambuca into a shooter glass.
Gently add 15ml of blue curaçao on top.
Gently pour 15ml of Baileys on top of the blue curaçao.
Add a few drops of grenadine.

cocktails.name: Jellyfish 3
cocktails.description: Yet another variation of the Jellyfish cocktail. This one is the strongest one.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 15ml of blue curaçao into a shooter glass.
Gently add 15ml of tequila on top.
Gently add 15ml of absinthe on top of the tequila.
Add a drop of Baileys.

cocktails.name: John Collins
cocktails.description: Refreshing gin highball with lemon, sugar, and soda.
cocktails.instructions:
Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a collins glass filled with ice.
Top with soda water and stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon slice and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Jolly Rancher
cocktails.description: Named after the popular American candy brand.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Pour 30ml of vodka, 30ml of Midori melon liqueur and 90ml of cranberry juice.
Shake and pour over the ice into a highball glass.

cocktails.name: Jungle Bird
cocktails.description: Tiki favorite blending dark rum, Campari, and pineapple.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: Kamikaze
cocktails.description: This popular cocktail is a variation of the original Kamikaze shooter.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 45ml of vodka, 15ml of triple sec and 5ml of lime juice.
Shake well and strain into a shooter glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Kings County
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward cocktail that balances the honeyed notes of Highland Scotch with a touch of Islay smoke and herbal complexity.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your Nick and Nora glass.
2. Combine Highland Scotch, Islay Scotch, Maraschino liqueur, and Punt e Mes in a mixing glass filled with ice.
3. Stir well for about 20-30 seconds until properly chilled and diluted.
4. Strain the mixture into the chilled glass.
5. Garnish with a lemon twist or a cherry if desired.

cocktails.name: Kir
cocktails.description: A classic French aperitif that elegantly combines the crispness of dry white wine with the sweet, dark fruit notes of blackcurrant liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour the Creme de Cassis into a chilled wine glass.
2. Top with dry white wine.
3. Stir gently to incorporate the liqueur without losing the wine's freshness.

cocktails.name: Kir Royal
cocktails.description: An upscale, effervescent version of the classic Kir, replacing still wine with Champagne for a celebratory and luxurious experience.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour the Creme de Cassis into the bottom of a chilled champagne flute.
2. Slowly top with chilled Champagne, allowing the bubbles to naturally mix the ingredients.
3. Stir very briefly and gently if needed to avoid losing carbonation.

cocktails.name: Ladykiller
cocktails.description: The very sweet and beautiful 1984 championship-winning cocktail created by Peter Roth from the Kronenhalle bar in Zürich.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Pour 30ml of gin, 15ml of Cointreau and 15ml of apricot brandy.
Add 60ml of passion fruit juice and 60ml of pineapple juice.
Shake and strain into a highball glass with 6-8 ice cubes.
Garnish with an orange peel, a cherry and mint leaves.

cocktails.name: Last Word
cocktails.description: Equal-parts gin, Chartreuse, maraschino, and lime.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Lava Flow
cocktails.description: A beautiful and mild cocktail. The recipe here is for 3–4 big glasses.
cocktails.instructions:
Blend 180g of strawberries with 90ml of light rum and 180ml of Malibu coconut rum.
Add a peeled banana, 180ml of coconut cream and 180ml of pineapple juice and blend again.
Pour into hurricane glasses over the strawberry puree.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: Lemon Drop Martini
cocktails.description: An IBA official variation of the Martini drink that is served as an all-day cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 30ml of vodka, 20ml of triple sec and 15ml of lemon juice.
Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

cocktails.name: Light Word
cocktails.description: A complex gin cocktail where Gin, Campari, Green Chartreuse meets citrus—bittersweet, zesty, and nicely structured.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine gin, Campari, green Chartreuse and lime juice in a shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled wine glass.

cocktails.name: Liquid Cocaine
cocktails.description: A very strong cocktail. Goldschläger is often substituted with other flavored schnapps or tequila. The recipe here is for 3 shots.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 50ml of overproof rum, 50ml of Goldschläger and 50ml of Jägermeister.
Shake well and strain into shots.

cocktails.name: Liquid Marijuana Long
cocktails.description: A quite complicated but beautiful toxic-colored exotic cocktail. There is also a much stronger shot version of this drink.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 15ml of dark rum, 15ml of blue curaçao, 15ml of Malibu and 15ml of Midori into a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 60ml of pineapple juice and 15ml of simple syrup and shake with ice.
Strain into a highball or hurricane glass over the ice.

cocktails.name: Liquid Marijuana Shot
cocktails.description: Unlike the long and mild version of the "Liquid Marijuana", this version is a strong shot but an equally beautiful drink.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 30ml of dark rum, 30ml of blue curaçao, 30ml of Malibu and 30ml of Midori into a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 30ml of pineapple juice, 30ml of lemon juice and 15ml of simple syrup.
Shake well and strain into shooter glasses.

cocktails.name: Liquorice
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward cocktail that highlights the botanical notes of gin balanced by the deep, anise-flavored complexity of Black Sambuca. This drink is smooth, aromatic, and perfect for those who enjoy bold, herbal profiles.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your cocktail glass in the freezer or by filling it with ice.
2. Combine gin, Black Sambuca, and rich simple syrup in a mixing glass.
3. Add 150g of ice to the mixing glass.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon for about 20-30 seconds until well-chilled.
5. Strain the mixture into the chilled cocktail glass.
6. Garnish with a piece of liquorice for an extra aromatic touch.

cocktails.name: Lisbon Martini
cocktails.description: A refined European twist on the classic Martini. The rich, fruity notes of Port wine blend seamlessly with the crispness of gin and the delicate floral sweetness of St. Germain elderflower liqueur, finished with a citrusy dash of bitters.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add the Port, Gin, St. Germain, and bitters into a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Stir the ingredients thoroughly until the mixing glass feels very cold to the touch.
3. Double strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass to ensure a smooth texture.
4. Serve immediately, perhaps with a twist of lemon or orange peel to enhance the aromas.

cocktails.name: London Calling
cocktails.description: Created in 2002 in London's Milk & Honey bar by Chris Jepson for a magazine competition. A well-known variation is the "Banana Calling".
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 45ml of dry gin, 15ml of dry sherry, 10ml of lemon juice and 10ml of simple syrup into a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 2 dashes of Angostura bitters and shake well.
Strain into a chilled Nick & Nora or martini glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

cocktails.name: Long Beach Iced Tea
cocktails.description: A variation of the Long Island Iced Tea with cranberry juice instead of cola.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour 15ml of vodka, tequila, white rum, triple sec and gin.
Add 25ml of lemon juice and 30ml of simple syrup.
Top with a splash of cranberry juice.

cocktails.name: Long Island Iced Tea
cocktails.description: Five-spirit sour lengthened with cola.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all spirits, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a highball glass filled with ice. 
Top up with cola and stir.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

cocktails.name: Longshoreman
cocktails.description: A bold, spirit-forward whiskey drink built around Punt e Mes, Rye Whisky, and Amaro. It is bitter-leaning, aromatic, and best served well-chilled in a rocks glass with a fresh orange twist.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine Rye Whisky, Punt e Mes, and Amaro in a mixing glass.
2. Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir well for about 20-30 seconds until thoroughly chilled.
3. Strain the mixture into a rocks glass over a large ice cube.
4. Garnish with an orange zest or slice.

cocktails.name: Love & Murder
cocktails.description: A bright and complex liqueur sour that balances the bitterness of Campari with the herbal notes of Green Chartreuse and fresh lime. A crisp, refreshing, and vibrant cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add Campari, Green Chartreuse, lime juice, and simple syrup into a shaker filled with ice.
2. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
3. Double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
4. Add a small pinch of salt on top if desired to enhance the flavors.

cocktails.name: Lovelight
cocktails.description: An elegant and sophisticated brandy-based drink. It combines the warmth of Cognac with the spicy depth of cinnamon and chocolate bitters, rounded out by bitter and vermouth notes.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add Cognac, Strucchi Bitter, Red Vermouth, cinnamon syrup, and chocolate bitters to a mixing glass.
2. Fill with ice and stir gently to combine and chill the ingredients.
3. Strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
4. Garnish with an orange peel and a small piece of chocolate on the side.

cocktails.name: Lucien Gaudin
cocktails.description: A cocktail named after Lucien Gaudin, a French fencer who won two gold medals in the 1924 and 1928 Olympic games, named similarly to the Negroni, with the addition of orange liqueur and with dry vermouth instead of sweet vermouth.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine 30ml of gin, 15ml of dry vermouth, 15ml of Cointreau and 15ml of Campari in a mixing glass with ice.
Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

cocktails.name: Lynchburg Lemonade
cocktails.description: A popular cocktail named after Lynchburg, Tennessee, the hometown of the Jack Daniel's Distillery.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a collins glass with ice.
Pour 30ml of Jack Daniels, 15ml of triple sec, 15ml of lemon juice and 15ml of sugar syrup.
Top with lemonade.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Mai Tai
cocktails.description: Rum-forward tiki classic with orange curaçao, lime, and orgeat.
cocktails.instructions:
Add rums, orange curaçao, lime juice, and orgeat into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

cocktails.name: Malibu Bay Breeze
cocktails.description: A simple, light and delicious cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Put some ice cubes into a highball glass.
Pour 45ml of Malibu, 60ml of cranberry juice and 60ml of pineapple juice over the ice.
Garnish with a slice of pineapple.

cocktails.name: Manhattan
cocktails.description: Spirit-forward mix of rye whisky, sweet vermouth, and bitters.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Manhattan Dry
cocktails.description: A good pre-dinner cocktail that is a variation of the Manhattan with dry vermouth.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Pour 50ml of rye or Canadian whisky with 20ml of dry vermouth into a mixing glass.
Add 1 dash of Angostura bitters.
Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Manhattan Medium
cocktails.description: Also called Perfect Manhattan, this is a combination of Manhattan and Manhattan Dry.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Pour 50ml of rye or Canadian whisky with 10ml of dry vermouth and 10ml of red vermouth into a mixing glass.
Add 1 dash of Angostura bitters.
Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Margarita
cocktails.description: Classic tequila sour balanced with triple sec and lime.
cocktails.instructions:
Rim a margarita glass with salt.
Add tequila, triple sec, and lime juice into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Maria McClaire
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and bold spirit-forward drink that harmoniously blends the richness of Port with the warmth of Irish whiskey and the botanical bitterness of Campari.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your cocktail glass in the freezer or by filling it with ice.
2. Add the Port, Irish Whisky, Campari, and Creole Bitters into a mixing glass.
3. Fill the mixing glass with ice cubes.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon for about 20-30 seconds until well-chilled.
5. Strain the mixture into the chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Martinez
cocktails.description: A legendary pre-Prohibition classic, often considered the father of the Martini, offering a perfect balance of sweet vermouth and botanical gin.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the Gin, Red Vermouth, Maraschino Liqueur, and Orange Bitters in a mixing glass.
2. Fill the mixing glass with plenty of ice.
3. Stir the ingredients thoroughly until the glass feels very cold.
4. Strain the liquid into a chilled cocktail glass.
5. Express the oils of a lemon twist over the drink and use it as a garnish.

cocktails.name: Martini Chocolate
cocktails.description: An indulgent and velvety dessert cocktail that combines premium vodka with the deep, rich notes of chocolate for a luxurious treat.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with a generous amount of ice cubes.
2. Pour the Vodka and Creme de Cacao (or chocolate liqueur) into the shaker.
3. Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to ensure a frothy and cold consistency.
4. Fine-strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
5. Garnish the top with freshly grated chocolate or a dusting of cocoa powder.

cocktails.name: Martini Dirty
cocktails.description: An IBA official variation of the Martini drink.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Add 60ml of vodka, 10ml of dry vermouth and 10ml of olive juice.
Stir and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an olive.

cocktails.name: Martini Perfect
cocktails.description: This is a combination of the Dry and Sweet Martini cocktails that makes a good pre-dinner cocktail. The amount of gin can be varied according to your taste.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Add 55ml of gin, 10ml of dry vermouth and 10ml of red vermouth.
Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Martini Sweet
cocktails.description: This is a variation of the Martini cocktail with sweet red vermouth instead of dry vermouth. The vodka to vermouth ratio can be varied according to your taste.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Add 55ml of vodka and 15ml of sweet red vermouth.
Stir well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Martini Vodka
cocktails.description: This is a vodka-based variation of the Martini cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Add 55ml of vodka and 15ml of dry vermouth.
Stir and strain into a cocktail glass.
Squeeze a lemon peel into the drink and garnish with a green olive.

cocktails.name: Mary Pickford
cocktails.description: Tropical rum and pineapple cocktail sweetened with maraschino and grenadine.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Maximilian Affair
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and bright agave spirit sour that masterfully balances the smokiness of Mezcal with the floral notes of Elderflower and the bitter-sweet complexity of Punt e Mes.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your coupe glass in the freezer or by filling it with ice.
2. Combine Mezcal, Elderflower Cordial, Punt e Mes, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Double strain the mixture into the chilled coupe glass.
5. Garnish with a lemon twist or wheel.

cocktails.name: Meat Hook
cocktails.description: A robust, spirit-forward variation of a modern classic. This cocktail pairs the spice of Rye with aromatic vermouth and a haunting hint of Islay smoke.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add the Rye Whisky, Punt e Mes, Maraschino Liqueur, and Islay Scotch Whiskey into a mixing glass.
2. Fill the mixing glass with ice cubes.
3. Stir gently for about 30 seconds to achieve the perfect dilution and temperature.
4. Strain the liquid into a chilled Nick and Nora glass.
5. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Melon Ball
cocktails.description: A vibrant and fruity highball that is incredibly easy to drink. The electric green color and sweet melon flavor make it a perfect summer party cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with fresh ice cubes.
2. Pour the vodka and melon liqueur directly over the ice.
3. Top the glass with fresh orange juice.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the layers.
5. Garnish with a melon ball or an orange slice if desired.

cocktails.name: Passion Fruit Porto Sour
cocktails.description: An elegant and velvety twist on the classic sour, blending the deep notes of Port wine with the botanical sharpness of Gin and tropical sweetness of passion fruit. The egg white creates a luxurious, frothy texture that makes this drink feel like a sophisticated liquid dessert.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine Port, Gin, lemon juice, passion fruit syrup, and egg white in a cocktail shaker.
2. Dry shake (without ice) vigorously for about 10-15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
3. Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
4. Fine strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
5. Garnish with a fresh passion fruit half or seeds on top.

cocktails.name: Peachy Blushing Bride
cocktails.description: A bright, celebratory sparkling cocktail with a beautiful sunset hue. This drink balances the lush sweetness of peach liqueur and grenadine with the crisp effervescence of Champagne, making it the perfect choice for toasts and festive brunches.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill your champagne flute before starting.
2. Pour the peach liqueur and grenadine into the bottom of the glass.
3. Gently add ice if the glass allows, or skip for a traditional flute presentation.
4. Top slowly with chilled Champagne, allowing the bubbles to naturally mix the colors.
5. Garnish with a fresh peach slice on the rim of the glass.

cocktails.name: Paradise Punch
cocktails.description: Escape to the tropics with this refreshing large-format cocktail. The creamy sweetness of coconut liqueur blends perfectly with crisp apple juice and the sophisticated, citrusy notes of Earl Grey tea. Balanced with fresh lime and simple syrup, it’s a bright, botanical punch perfect for sharing.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Brew the Earl Grey tea in advance and allow it to cool completely.
2. Fill a large pitcher halfway with fresh ice cubes.
3. Pour the coconut liqueur, simple syrup, lime juice, apple juice, and cooled Earl Grey tea into the pitcher.
4. Stir the mixture gently with a long spoon to combine all the flavors and chill the liquid.
5. Thinly slice one lime and add it to the pitcher, then add the fresh raspberries for color.
6. Serve in glasses filled with ice, ensuring each serving gets a bit of the fruit garnish.

cocktails.name: Pale Charlie
cocktails.description: An intriguing and sophisticated long drink that balances the tartness of grapefruit and lime with the botanical richness of Sloe Gin and Apricot Brandy. The addition of a dash of absinthe and a topper of ale creates a complex, effervescent experience with a refreshing herbal finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill a Collins glass by filling it with ice or placing it in the freezer.
2. In a cocktail shaker, combine the Sloe Gin, Apricot Brandy, Grapefruit Juice, Lime Juice, and dashes of Absinthe.
3. Add a generous handful of ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
5. Gently top up the glass with the ale.
6. Give it a brief, light stir to integrate the flavors without losing the carbonation.
7. Garnish with a grapefruit twist or a lime wheel if desired.

cocktails.name: Momisette
cocktails.description: A long, sparkling spirit drink built for easy sipping, pairing Pastis, Almond (Orgeat) Syrup with bubbly mixers over ice.

cocktails.name: Monkey Gland
cocktails.description: Gin and orange cocktail with a hint of absinthe and grenadine.
cocktails.instructions:
Add gin, orange juice, absinthe, and grenadine into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

cocktails.name: Moscow Mule
cocktails.description: Vodka and ginger beer built over ice with a bright lime kick.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a copper mug with ice.
Add vodka and lime juice.
Top with ginger beer and gently stir.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Michelada
cocktails.description: Legend has it that the Michelada was invented in the Mexican city San Luis Potosí, either by General Don Augusto Michel in the 1920s or by a bar regular named Michel Esper in the 1970s. Many variations exist, with the amount of lime juice, sauces and juice can be varied according to taste.
cocktails.instructions:
Rim a pint glass or highball glass with salt and, optionally, chili powder. Fill the glass with ice.
Add 30ml lime juice, 2 dashes of tabasco, 2 dashes of Worcestershire sauce and, optionally, 30ml of tomato juice.
Pour 355ml of beer and stir.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Midori Illusion
cocktails.description: A sweet and fresh popular cocktail. Many varieties exist, such as stronger ones with less pineapple juice and those without lemon juice and blue curaçao.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 45ml of Midori, 15ml of triple sec, 15ml of vodka, 20ml of lemon juice and 45ml of pineapple juice.
Shake and strain into a highball or hurricane glass.
Optionally top with lemonade.

cocktails.name: Midori Sour
cocktails.description: One of the classic sours.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
Add 50ml of Midori, 20ml of lemon juice and 20ml of sugar syrup.
Stir gently.

cocktails.name: Milano Torino
cocktails.description: Also known as "Mi-To," this cocktail was created around 1860 in a cafe in Milan, Italy. It is named after the ingredients: Campari is from Milan, and sweet vermouth is from Turin. With the addition of soda, this drink turns into the "Americano" cocktail, and with gin, it turns into the "Negroni."
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Add 30ml of Campari and 30ml of sweet red vermouth.
Stir and garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Mimosa
cocktails.description: Brunch favorite combining sparkling wine and fresh orange juice.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour orange juice into a chilled champagne flute.
Top with champagne.
Stir gently.

cocktails.name: Mind Eraser
cocktails.description: A long, sparkling vodka drink built for easy sipping, pairing Vodka, Coffee Liqueur, Tonic with bubbly mixers over ice.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
2. Add 30ml of vodka, 30ml of coffee liqueur and 30ml of tonic water.
3. Stir slightly.

cocktails.name: Mint Julep
cocktails.description: Bourbon refresher with muddled mint and sugar over crushed ice.
cocktails.instructions:
Muddle mint leaves, sugar, and water in a rocks glass.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Add bourbon and stir until chilled.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

cocktails.name: Missionary's Downfall
cocktails.description: Blended tiki mix of rum, peach liqueur, pineapple, mint, and honey.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a blender with ice.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a highball glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

cocktails.name: Mojito
cocktails.description: Cuban highball with rum, lime, mint, sugar, and sparkling soda.
cocktails.instructions:
Muddle mint leaves and sugar with lime juice in a highball glass.
Add rum and fill the glass with crushed ice.
Top with soda water and gently stir.
Garnish with a mint sprig and lime slice.

cocktails.name: Mojito Pomegranate
cocktails.description: A pomegranate variation of Mojito.
cocktails.instructions:
Put 4 sprigs of mint and 2 teaspoons of sugar into a highball glass.
Add 30ml of lime juice and muddle mint sprigs.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Pour 40ml of white rum and 50ml of pomegranate juice, and top with 100ml of soda water.
Garnish with a sprig of mint leaves.

cocktails.name: Metropolis
cocktails.description: A tropical and refreshing highball that blends the creamy sweetness of coconut with the crisp, tart notes of apple juice. Perfect for those who enjoy a lush, beachy vibe in a light cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 60ml of coconut liqueur over the ice.
3. Top up the glass with 150ml of apple juice.
4. Stir gently to combine the flavors.
5. Garnish with apple slices.

cocktails.name: Mexican Mule
cocktails.description: The Mexican Mule — also known as El Burro or the Jalisco Mule — is a bold variation on the Moscow Mule, substituting vodka with tequila for an earthy, spicy kick.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a copper mug or Collins glass with crushed ice.
2. Pour 60ml of tequila blanco and 15ml of lime juice over the ice.
3. Add 15ml of simple syrup if a sweeter taste is preferred.
4. Top with 90ml of ginger beer.
5. Stir gently and garnish with a lime slice.

cocktails.name: Miami Beach
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and dry cocktail that combines the smokiness of Scotch with the herbal notes of dry vermouth and the tartness of fresh grapefruit juice.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add 30ml of Scotch whiskey, 30ml of dry vermouth, and 30ml of grapefruit juice to the shaker.
3. Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
4. Strain the liquid into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Motox
cocktails.description: A refreshing and aromatic citrus-forward cocktail that balances the spicy kick of fresh ginger and coriander with the bright notes of lemon vodka and limoncello, rounded off with tropical juices.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Muddle the fresh ginger and coriander leaves in a shaker to release their aromatic oils.
2. Add the Vodka Citron, Limoncello, pineapple juice, and apple juice to the shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
4. Double strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass to remove small bits of ginger and herbs.
5. Garnish with a fresh sprig of coriander.

cocktails.name: Mrs Daisy Robinson
cocktails.description: An elegant and sparkling Pisco-based drink that offers a sophisticated blend of tropical pineapple and tart grapefruit, finished with the effervescence of Prosecco.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine Pisco, pineapple syrup, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and Creole bitters in a cocktail shaker with ice.
2. Shake well until the exterior of the shaker feels cold.
3. Strain the mixture into a chilled champagne flute.
4. Top up the glass with Prosecco.
5. Garnish with a fresh pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: Mudslide
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy, and indulgent cocktail. This decadent mix of vodka, coffee liqueur, and Irish cream is a smooth variation of the classic Black Russian.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with fresh ice cubes.
2. Pour the vodka, coffee liqueur, and Baileys directly over the ice.
3. Stir gently with a bar spoon or mixing tin to combine the ingredients without over-diluting.
4. Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Mulled Wine
cocktails.description: Also called "Glühwein" in German, this drink is very popular in German-speaking countries, France and Russia. Spices can be varied greatly – just use what you like.
cocktails.instructions:
Heat a bottle or more of red wine in a pan.
Add cinnamon sticks, cloves, sugar and vanilla pods.
Add lemon wedges, and wait 10 minutes.
Heat until the wine almost boils, and serve in cups.

cocktails.name: Naked and Famous
cocktails.description: Equal parts mezcal, Aperol, yellow chartreuse, and lime for a smoky, bittersweet sour.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Naked Lady
cocktails.description: A very interesting combination of gentle sweetness and a light touch of sour, resulting in a delicious, classic drink.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Add 50ml of white rum and 50ml of red vermouth.
Add 10ml of apricot brandy, 10ml of grenadine and 10ml of lemon juice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Negroni
cocktails.description: Classic Italian aperitif of gin, bitters, and sweet vermouth.
cocktails.instructions:
Add gin, Campari, and red vermouth into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir well.
Strain into a chilled rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

cocktails.name: Negroni Sbagliato
cocktails.description: A twist on the classic Negroni where prosecco replaces gin, yielding a lighter and fruitier drink.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
Add 30ml of Campari and 30ml of red vermouth.
Top with sparkling wine.
Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Neptune's Wrath
cocktails.description: The creation of this cocktail is credited to Toby Malone, who first prepared it for the Violet Hour in Chicago.
cocktails.instructions:
Add 45ml of gin, 20ml of lemon juice, 20ml of simple syrup, an egg white and 7ml of absinthe to a cocktail shaker.
Shake without ice to foam the egg white, then add ice and shake again.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Flame 7ml of green Chartreuse in a separate container and pour it on top.

cocktails.name: New York Sour
cocktails.description: Whiskey sour finished with a float of red wine.
cocktails.instructions:
Add bourbon, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white into a shaker without ice.
Dry shake to emulsify.
Add ice and shake again until chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Float red wine on top.

cocktails.name: Nuclear Meltdown
cocktails.description: A potent and fiery shooter that combines the intense heat of cinnamon-infused Firewater with the sweet, gold-flecked luxury of Goldschläger. It is a spirit-forward drink designed for those who enjoy a spicy kick and a shimmering presentation.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Chill a shooter glass in the freezer for a few minutes.
2. Fill a mixing glass or shaker with ice cubes.
3. Pour 20ml of Firewater and 20ml of Goldschläger over the ice.
4. Stir gently to chill the mixture without over-diluting the spirits.
5. Strain the mixture into the chilled shooter glass.
6. Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Nutty Irishman
cocktails.description: A smooth, creamy classic that highlights the harmonious blend of hazelnut and Irish cream. Perfect for fans of dessert-style cocktails, it offers a rich texture and a comforting nutty finish that can be customized with coffee or whiskey.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add 30ml of Frangelico, 30ml of Baileys, and 30ml of cream to the shaker.
3. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
5. Optionally, top with a layer of loose whipped cream.
6. Garnish with a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Oatmeal Cookie
cocktails.description: This sweet and nostalgic shooter tastes remarkably like its namesake dessert. The combination of cinnamon, butterscotch, and Irish cream creates a flavor profile of baked goods, with an optional touch of Jägermeister adding a complex herbal depth.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with a generous amount of ice cubes.
2. Add 30ml of Goldschläger and 30ml of butterscotch liqueur (or schnapps).
3. Pour in 30ml of Baileys Irish Cream.
4. Add 30ml of Jägermeister if you prefer the herbal 'spiced' version of the cookie.
5. Shake the ingredients hard until the shaker is frost-cold.
6. Strain the mixture evenly into 3 or 4 shooter glasses.

cocktails.name: Old Cuban
cocktails.description: Sparkling mix of aged rum, mint, lime, and champagne.
cocktails.instructions:
Muddle mint leaves with simple syrup in a shaker.
Add rum, lime juice, and bitters with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Top with champagne and garnish with a mint sprig.

cocktails.name: Old Fashioned
cocktails.description: Time-honored mix of whiskey, sugar, and bitters.
cocktails.instructions:
Place sugar in a rocks glass and saturate with bitters.
Add a splash of water and muddle until dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice and add bourbon.
Stir gently.
